instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4824: What is 820-4824? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4824</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Back Light Melt Down fixed.   Now Wrong Way
threads.message:
I should of never tried to fix this board, but it's the weekend and on weekends I play in the toy box!
This board had a back light melt down! <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> burnt off multiple traces down to the ground plane so I had to make them from scratch! I am sure we have all seen this.

After I fixed it now I get a "Wrong Way" sign after it shows the apple logo for a second. What is wrong way?

I have tried my test SSD and my external USB test drive. Both have the same problem.  The SSD is APFS the external is the old file system.  Both show a apple logo for a second.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4824</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Back Light Melt Down fixed.   Now Wrong Way
threads.message:
Did you try USB OSX disconnecting internal SSD?
ALso try to start from pendrive installer and see what happens.
